section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: BBIA is a member of BON, the Bioplastics Organisations Network, loosely managed by the European Bioplastics Association. BBIA is also member of the Scottish IBIOIC, and is member of two committees on the British Standards Institute, dealing with compostable packaging and Circular Economy
goals__remit: The Association's mission is to promote the bioeconomy in the UK and specifically the development of markets for bio-based and biodegradable products and chemicals as well as their production in the UK.  The association represents those industries active in these markets, and affiliated organisations and consultancies.
relevant_communication: The Association was established in June 2015. Since then it has participated in the UK on the legislation regarding shopping (carrier) bags; Circular Economy and waste policy; soil quality; and has held several events, including a launch of a report on the Role of Bioplastics in the UK Economy in October 2015 at the House of Lords, and on April 28 2016 in York on industrial biotechnologies. Currrently BBIA is focusing on the UK industrial, waste and resources, plastics, and bioeconomy strategies of the Government.
